comments:
Created an attachment (id=79458)
Screenshot of the Module Dependencies dialogue

Import this EAR file: http://www.informatik.fh-wiesbaden.de/~knauf/SWTVertiefung2007/stateless/Stateless.ear
(is for a JBoss 4.2).
It will build fine.
Now close Eclipse and restart it.

The project will not build, the ejb classes in web project and app client project cannot be resolved.

Workaround: open "J2EE Module Dependencies" for the EAR project, and you will see that the checkboxes are wrong (upper part of the screenshot).
Uncheck "StatelessWeb.war", which references project "Stateless", and check "StatelessEJB" and "StatelessWeb" (lower part of screenshot). Now the project will build again. This has to be repeated each time Eclipse is started :-(

The same happens if all four projects are closed and reopened (without restarting Eclipse).


This worked in 2.0.0. 2.0.1 with Eclipse 3.3.1 is broken. The full Europa build from the download page (eclipse-jee-europa-fall-win32.zip, contains WTP 2.0.1 dated 2007-09-11) has the same problem, so this regression seems to be introduced after 2.0.0.
I tested it with a several blank workspaces.

The log contains this exception (after closing and reopening the project):

*** Bug 205775 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
I am confirming that the fix, which is suggested in 205775, closes irregularities with 'Stateless.ear', which are described here.
Looks like I didn't quite get the fix right for 2.0.1.

Created an attachment (id=80097)
Rewrote the method for performance and correctness.
unfortunately, this particular NPE had not appeared (not quite certain why...) the  RC3 version of 2.0.1 that I had tested with the patch that had initially altered the dependent-object behavior...

strange... just tried with the R-2.0.1-20070926042742 release and was unable to repro with newly created projects: 

-created a 5.0 EAR, 3.0 EJB child project, 2.5 dynamic web project
-web had a dependency on the EJB
-verified that the EAR component file had "<dependent-object/>"
-closed and reopened the workspace, no error

-imported Stateless.ear, closed and reopened the workspace and the NPE did repro;  not clear from initial inspection what's causing the difference in behavior... 

Are others seeing similar behavior?

Rob, what you saw is what I saw in preparation for fixing this bug.  (But with the patch I attached, both cases worked for me.)

This was committed to 2.0.2 and 3.0 in time for this week's integration builds.
ok - looks like the presence of an application.xml in the EAR is required for this to repro
*** Bug 206141 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Verified against wtp-M-2.0.2-20071018074037.zip, works fine !

Thanks for fixing it.
